pykoi.rlhf package#

Submodules#

pykoi.rlhf.rlhf module#

class pykoi.rlhf.rlhf.RL(rlhf_config: RLHFConfig)[source]#

Bases: Trainer

create_dataset(tokenizer)[source]#

Build dataset for training. This builds the dataset from load_dataset, one should customize this function to train the model on its own dataset.

create_tokenizer(model_name)[source]#
data_collator(data)[source]#
train()[source]#

Main training entry point.

Parameters:

  • resume_from_checkpoint (str or bool, optional) – If a str, local path to a saved checkpoint as saved by a previous instance of [Trainer]. If a bool and equals True, load the last checkpoint in args.output_dir as saved by a previous instance of [Trainer]. If present, training will resume from the model/optimizer/scheduler states loaded here.

  • trial (optuna.Trial or Dict[str, Any], optional) – The trial run or the hyperparameter dictionary for hyperparameter search.

  • ignore_keys_for_eval (List[str], optional) – A list of keys in the output of your model (if it is a dictionary) that should be ignored when gathering predictions for evaluation during the training.

  • kwargs (Dict[str, Any], optional) – Additional keyword arguments used to hide deprecated arguments

class pykoi.rlhf.rlhf.RewardDataCollatorWithPadding(tokenizer, max_length)[source]#

Bases: object

class pykoi.rlhf.rlhf.RewardTrainer(rlhf_config: RLHFConfig)[source]#

Bases: Trainer

compute_loss(model, inputs, return_outputs=False)[source]#

How the loss is computed by Trainer. By default, all models return the loss in the first element.

Subclass and override for custom behavior.

create_datasets()[source]#

Load the dataset and preprocess it.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the train and eval datasets.

save(output_path=None)[source]#

Save the model.

Parameters:

output_path (str, optional) – The output path to save the model. If not provided, the model will be saved to the default output path.

train_and_save(output_path=None)[source]#

Train the model and save it.

Parameters:

output_path (str, optional) – The output path to save the model. If not provided, the model will be saved to the default output path.

class pykoi.rlhf.rlhf.SFT(rlhf_config: RLHFConfig)[source]#

Bases: Trainer

A class representing the supervised finetuning trainer.

rlhf_config#

The RLHF configuration object.

Type:

RLHFConfig

tokenizer#

The tokenizer used for tokenizing the input data.

Type:

AutoTokenizer

num_proc#

The number of workers to use for data loading.

Type:

int

dataset#

A dictionary containing the train and eval datasets.

Type:

Dict[str, Dataset]

torch_dtype#

The torch data type to use for training.

Type:

torch.dtype

training_args#

The training arguments for the trainer.

Type:

TrainingArguments

model#

The model to train.

Type:

AutoModelForCausalLM

trainer#

The trainer object used for training the model.

Type:

SFTTrainer
